llm_response:
Here is the YAML file for the GitHub workflow `nf-core AWS test`:
```yaml
name: nf-core AWS test
on:
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      - name: Run AWS tests
        id: run-tower
        if: github.repository == 'nf-core/mag'
        runs-on: ubuntu-latest
        steps:
          - name: Launch workflow via tower
            uses: nf-core/tower-action@v3
            with:
              workspace_id: ${{ secrets.TOWER_WORKSPACE_ID }}
              access_token: ${{ secrets.TOWER_ACCESS_TOKEN }}
              compute_env: ${{ secrets.TOWER_COMPUTE_ENV }}
              workdir: s3://${{ secrets.AWS_S3_BUCKET }}/work/mag/work-${{ github.sha }}
              parameters:
                outdir: s3://${{ secrets.AWS_S3_BUCKET }}/mag/results-test-${{ github.sha }}
              profiles: test,aws_tower
```
This workflow is triggered by a workflow dispatch event, which means that someone manually triggers the workflow. The workflow has one job, named `Run AWS tests`, which runs only if the condition `github.repository == 'nf-core/mag'` is met. The job runs on an `ubuntu-latest` runner. The job has one step, named `Launch workflow via tower`, which runs the `nf-core/tower-action` action tagged as v3. The step defines six input parameters for the action: `workspace_id`, `access_token`, `compute_env`, `workdir`, `parameters`, and `profiles`. The `workspace_id`, `access_token`, and `compute_env` parameters are set to the values of the `TOWER_WORKSPACE_ID`, `TOWER_ACCESS_TOKEN`, and `TOWER_COMPUTE_ENV` secrets, respectively. The `workdir` parameter is set to `s3://${{ secrets.AWS_S3_BUCKET }}/work/mag/work-${{ github.sha }}`, and the `parameters` parameter is set to `{
  "outdir": "s3://${{ secrets.AWS_S3_BUCKET }}/mag/results-test-${{ github.sha }}"
}`. The `profiles` parameter is set to `test,aws_tower`.
